headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: India: Militant Separatists Kill 11

lead_paragraph: The police said suspected militants in the northeastern state of Assam killed 11 people yesterday. Guerrillas from the National Democratic Front of Bodoland want statehood for the Bodo tribe and contend that the tribal people's welfare has been neglected. Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
abstract: Police say suspected militants in Indian state of Assam killed 11 people; guerrillas there seek separate state (S)
